examSummary.fullName: EUEE Civic and Ethical Education 2008 Grade 12
examSummary.subject: Biology

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following country is considered as a model of the parliamentary democracy?
questionList.choiceA: United Kingdom.
questionList.choiceB: South Korea.
questionList.choiceC: Russia Federation.
questionList.choiceD: United States of America.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is a democratic right?
questionList.choiceA: Rights to life and liberty.
questionList.choiceB: Freedom of religion and belief.
questionList.choiceC: Rights of assembly and demonstration.
questionList.choiceD: The right to the security of person.

questionList.questionStatement: One of the following indicates the importance of a democratic system. Which one is it?
questionList.choiceA: It upholds absolute equality among citizens.
questionList.choiceB: It gives peoples representatives unlimited political power.
questionList.choiceC: It allows citizens to have a little participation in policy debate.
questionList.choiceD: It promotes economic. cultural and political equality.

questionList.questionStatement: Direct democracy can be:
questionList.choiceA: used to pass proclamations in a parliamentary system.
questionList.choiceB: practiced to make important decisions through a referendum.
questionList.choiceC: considered as a modern form of democracy widely practiced all over the world.
questionList.choiceD: easily practiced in small countries in the process of policy making.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is correct in the current Ethiopian context?
questionList.choiceA: Both direct democracy and indirect democracy are exercised in today’s Ethiopia.
questionList.choiceB: There is no opportunity to exercise direct democracy in the country.
questionList.choiceC: The country exercises parliamentary and presidential democracies.
questionList.choiceD: As compared to group rights, the country gives priority to individual rights.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is correct in a democratic system?
questionList.choiceA: Elected representatives are not accountable for failures in official duties.
questionList.choiceB: Government officials are protected from legal scrutiny during their term of office.
questionList.choiceC: Diversity of political views are appreciated and managed in a civil manner.
questionList.choiceD: High government officials shall inform the people about military strategies of the country.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is correct about the Ethiopian federal system?
questionList.choiceA: Devolution of power to the regional states moderates the power of the federal state.
questionList.choiceB: Members of the House of the Federation are directly elected by the people.
questionList.choiceC: Collection of revenue and tax is the exclusive power of the federal state.
questionList.choiceD: The federal state monopolizes power by controlling foreign, national and local affairs.

questionList.questionStatement: An international climate change convention adopted in 2015 is:
questionList.choiceA: The Oslo Protocol.
questionList.choiceB: The Vienna Agreement.
questionList.choiceC: The Beijing Declaration.
questionList.choiceD: The Paris Agreement.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is true about Ethiopia?
questionList.choiceA: It was one of the founding members of the World Trade Organization.
questionList.choiceB: It joined the League of Nations when most of the African countries were under colony.
questionList.choiceC: It sent peacekeeping forces to South Korea immediately after the First World War.
questionList.choiceD: It became the member of the United Nations before the Second World War.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is correct about the Council of Constitutional Inquiry?
questionList.choiceA: it examines constitutional disputes and submits recommendations to the House of the Federation.
questionList.choiceB: It has the power to make decisions on matters of constitutional disputes.
questionList.choiceC: It is established by a law enacted by the House of the Federation.
questionList.choiceD: It undertakes its activities under the supervision of the Council of Ministers.

questionList.questionStatement: An international organization established after the Second World War to assist the reconstruction of Europe is:
questionList.choiceA: World Bank
questionList.choiceB: World Trade Organization
questionList.choiceC: Intergovernmental Development Authority
questionList.choiceD: International Monetary Fund

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is correct about the democratic system exercised in Ethiopia?
questionList.choiceA: The system of checks and balances of Ethiopia and the United States is quite similar.
questionList.choiceB: The country has begun developing the culture of democracy in the recent decades.
questionList.choiceC: The country exercises a democratic system similar to the French political system.
questionList.choiceD: The country’s President can cancel bills approved by the House of Representatives.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is correct about the League of Nations?
questionList.choiceA: It accepted most of the African countries as its members.
questionList.choiceB: It accepted Ethiopia as its member without any opposition.
questionList.choiceC: It failed to protect Ethiopia from the Italian invasion.
questionList.choiceD: It was a global organization established before World War I.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is true about the Organization of African Unity (OAU)?
questionList.choiceA: It's headquarter was changed three times.
questionList.choiceB: It was founded by independent African countries.
questionList.choiceC: It's first headquarter was in Dakar, Senegal.
questionList.choiceD: It was established by former British colonies.

questionList.questionStatement: One of the following is correct about the federal system of Ethiopia. Which one is it?
questionList.choiceA: It allows the federal system to interfere in every aspect of regional affairs.
questionList.choiceB: It strengths the authority of the center by weakening the power to regional states.
questionList.choiceC: It gives the federal state an exclusive power to control economic matters in the regional states.
questionList.choiceD: It allows regional states to develop and implement their own development programs.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is correct about the hybrid democratic system practiced in countries like France?
questionList.choiceA: The President is assigned as a powerful head of the government.
questionList.choiceB: The Prime Minister leads the government under a close supervision of the President.
questionList.choiceC: The President serves as the head of the state with a nominal political power.
questionList.choiceD: The Prime Minster is elected by a popular vote through a separate electoral process.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is correct about the nature of a modern democratic constitution?
questionList.choiceA: It requires a permanent Constitutional Assembly to draft relevant amendments.
questionList.choiceB: The responsibility of drawing up a constitution is given to the parliament.
questionList.choiceC: It is subject to amendments to accommodate rapidly changing circumstances.
questionList.choiceD: The existence of constitutional law guarantees the prevalence of the rule of law.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is INCORRECT about globalization?
questionList.choiceA: It strengthens the interconnectedness of countries around the world.
questionList.choiceB: It affects developed and developing countries in a similar way.
questionList.choiceC: It has economic, political and cultural implications for world countries.
questionList.choiceD: It brings opportunities as well as challenges for developing countries.

questionList.questionStatement: The sovereignty of the Ethiopian Constitution is expressed by the:
questionList.choiceA: power of the Council ofMinisters.
questionList.choiceB: existence of several opposition parties.
questionList.choiceC: parliament with elected representatives.
questionList.choiceD: country’s rapid economic development.

questionList.questionStatement: The author of the Declaration of Independence is:
questionList.choiceA: Abraham Lincoln.
questionList.choiceB: George Washington.
questionList.choiceC: John F. Kennedy.
questionList.choiceD: Thomas Jefferson.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is correct about constitutionalism?
questionList.choiceA: It shows the prevalence of the parliamentary democracy.
questionList.choiceB: It shows that actions of citizens and government are governed by the supreme law.
questionList.choiceC: It indicates the existence of a modern written constitution.
questionList.choiceD: It prevails in all forms of political system in the modern world.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is INCORRECT about corruption?
questionList.choiceA: It erodes public confidence in government offices.
questionList.choiceB: It hinders the development process of a country.
questionList.choiceC: It discourages domestic and international investment.
questionList.choiceD: It includes all sorts of illegal and criminal activities.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is correct about corruption?
questionList.choiceA: It is an abuse of public office for private gains.
questionList.choiceB: It is a problem of some developing countries.
questionList.choiceC: It can be eradicated through harsh penalities.
questionList.choiceD: It has been eliminated from developed nations.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is correct about Ethiopia during the period of Emperor Haile Silassie?
questionList.choiceA: Ethiopia defeated the Italian army at the battle ofAdwa.
questionList.choiceB: Ethiopia was invaded by a two Western colonial power: Italy and Germany.
questionList.choiceC: Ethiopia became a member of the League ofNations and the United Nations.
questionList.choiceD: Ethiopia had a strong relationship with socialist countries of the time.

questionList.questionStatement: One of the following contradicts the rule of law and procedural justice in relation to accused persons. Which one is it?
questionList.choiceA: Allowing accused persons to have access to any evidence presented against them.
questionList.choiceB: Arresting accused persons without informing the charges against them.
questionList.choiceC: Giving the charges against them in writing with sufficient particulars.
questionList.choiceD: Informing the charges against them in the language they understand well.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is INCORRECT about legal provisions?
questionList.choiceA: They must be impartial and free of bias.
questionList.choiceB: They must be free from ambiguous jargons.
questionList.choiceC: They shall not contradict constitutional laws.
questionList.choiceD: They shall be complex and abstract.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is correct about the protection against double jeopardy?
questionList.choiceA: A person convicted for an offence shall not be convicted again for the same offence.
questionList.choiceB: A person charged for a crime has the right to a quick public trial.
questionList.choiceC: An accused person has the right to be represented by a legal counsel.
questionList.choiceD: A person charged for an offence has no burden to prove his/her innocence.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is true based on due process of law?
questionList.choiceA: Judges in the court of law are expected to support the defendant.
questionList.choiceB: Arrested persons can appeal for habeas corpus after forty eight hours.
questionList.choiceC: Arrested persons are presumed criminal the moment they are apprehended
questionList.choiceD: The defendant has the burden of providing evidence to prove innocence.

questionList.questionStatement: Which one of the following is correct about the rule of law?
questionList.choiceA: It manifests itself in all forms of government and political systems.
questionList.choiceB: Its existence has no connection with the prevalence of democracy.
questionList.choiceC: It establishes restrictions on government officials to protect the rights of citizens.
questionList.choiceD: It sets citizens free to enjoy their rights without legal restrictions.

questionList.questionStatement: The best way of fighting against corruption is:
questionList.choiceA: waiting for the good will of government officials.
questionList.choiceB: accepting corruption as a problem existing everywhere.
questionList.choiceC: adapting to the situation and tolerating corrupt officials.
questionList.choiceD: mobilizing active and informed public movements.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is correct about governments abiding by the rule of law?
questionList.choiceA: Exercising unlimited authority to run government business.
questionList.choiceB: Application of the principle of “no man is above the law”.
questionList.choiceC: Exposing individuals to arbitrary actions of elected officials.
questionList.choiceD: Allowing government officials to make decisions as they wish.

questionList.questionStatement: The purpose of division of power in a federal system is to
questionList.choiceA: empower regions by reducing the concentration of power at the center.
questionList.choiceB: give more authoritative powers to the central government.
questionList.choiceC: subordinate regional governments to the central government.
questionList.choiceD: make regional governments free from the control of the federal state.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is INCORRECT about a federal state?
questionList.choiceA: It is characterized by the decentralization of political power.
questionList.choiceB: It may have parliamentary or presidential from of government.
questionList.choiceC: It shall have a single constitution that governs the federal and regional states.
questionList.choiceD: It could be organized based on geography or population settlement.

questionList.questionStatement: The main purpose of having the three branches of government is:
questionList.choiceA: promoting a socialist style of governance.
questionList.choiceB: following international standard of governance.
questionList.choiceC: adapting the Western structuring of administration.
questionList.choiceD: maintaining the system of checks and balances

questionList.questionStatement: A belief in the superiority of one’s cultural groups refers to
questionList.choiceA: ethnocentrism
questionList.choiceB: prejudice
questionList.choiceC: cultural relativism
questionList.choiceD: cultural universalism

questionList.questionStatement: The major purpose of interest groups is:
questionList.choiceA: taking political power.
questionList.choiceB: supporting the ruling party.
questionList.choiceC: struggling against government.
questionList.choiceD: influencing government policy.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is true about the Derg period?
questionList.choiceA: “Land to the Tiller” was declared.
questionList.choiceB: Multi—party system was encouraged.
questionList.choiceC: A democratic system was promoted.
questionList.choiceD: A civilian government ruled the country.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following has a negative implication for gender equality in Ethiopia?
questionList.choiceA: Current legal provisions on property rights.
questionList.choiceB: Legal provisions against harmful traditional practices.
questionList.choiceC: Affirmative actions aimed at empowering girls and women.
questionList.choiceD: Customs that force women to undergo female genital cutting.

questionList.questionStatement: One of the following is among the rights of citizens. Which one is it?
questionList.choiceA: Observing the law of the land.
questionList.choiceB: Running for political office.
questionList.choiceC: Respecting the rights of others.
questionList.choiceD: Acting ethically and responsibly.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is correct about peasant revolts in Ethiopia?
questionList.choiceA: The Gojam Peasant Rebellion was crushed by British forces that used aircrafts.
questionList.choiceB: Except Gojam, Tigrai and Bale there were no other peasant uprisings in Ethiopia.
questionList.choiceC: The Bale Peasant Rebellion was caused by government demand of contributions to erect the statue of the Emperor.
questionList.choiceD: The First Woyane Movement was partly triggered by the corruption of the army stationed in Raya and Azebo.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is correct about affirmative action?
questionList.choiceA: It is a practice Widely implemented by poor countries.
questionList.choiceB: It gives excessive advantage to one group against another.
questionList.choiceC: Some people consider it as another form of discrimination.
questionList.choiceD: It is criticized for giving an enormous power to rich people.

questionList.questionStatement: One of the following is correct about equity of benefits and burdens. Which one is it?
questionList.choiceA: Minority groups are entitled to fewer benefits.
questionList.choiceB: Those who shoulder heavy burden should gain more benefit.
questionList.choiceC: Burdens, not benefits, should be distributed equally.
questionList.choiceD: Those who work less should be generously subsidized.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is correct about equality?
questionList.choiceA: Equality refers to the provision of equal opportunity for all concerned.
questionList.choiceB: Remedial actions for past injustices contradicts the principle of equality.
questionList.choiceC: In exercising equality the use of rights cannot be conditioned by obligations.
questionList.choiceD: Providing equal opportunity can be considered as an affirmative action.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is correct about gender issues in Ethiopia?
questionList.choiceA: The current regime is the first to raise the question of gender equality.
questionList.choiceB: Gender equality has been respected throughout the history of the country.
questionList.choiceC: Currently Ethiopian women are benefiting from affirmative actions.
questionList.choiceD: Women were exclusively removed from political power in the history of Ethiopia.

questionList.questionStatement: In most countries the term “government benefits” are related to.
questionList.choiceA: payment of wages.
questionList.choiceB: collection of taxes.
questionList.choiceC: protection of public properties.
questionList.choiceD: social welfare provisions.

questionList.questionStatement: The principle that says people earning the same amount of income should pay the same amount of tax is called:
questionList.choiceA: ability to pay.
questionList.choiceB: democratic taxation.
questionList.choiceC: horizontal equity.
questionList.choiceD: progressive taxation.

questionList.questionStatement: In terms of morality, which of the following is the best way of earning a better income?
questionList.choiceA: Disregarding some professions.
questionList.choiceB: Looking for easy ways of making money.
questionList.choiceC: Working hard in the area of one’s profession.
questionList.choiceD: Creating friendship with wealthy persons.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is quite different from all others?
questionList.choiceA: Racial discrimination
questionList.choiceB: Affirmative action
questionList.choiceC: Reverse discrimination
questionList.choiceD: Positive discrimination

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following true about the purpose of civic knowledge?
questionList.choiceA: Making citizens politically motivated.
questionList.choiceB: Empowering citizens to make an informed decision.
questionList.choiceC: Promoting abstract and theoretical knowledge.
questionList.choiceD: Encouraging people to be extremely religious.

questionList.questionStatement: The consequence of unfair distribution of benefits and burdens can be manifested in:
questionList.choiceA: strengthening cooperative attitude.
questionList.choiceB: encouraging hardworking people.
questionList.choiceC: spreading violence and conflict.
questionList.choiceD: accelerating the development process.

questionList.questionStatement: Collecting different amount of tax from different amount of income is reflected in:
questionList.choiceA: circular equity.
questionList.choiceB: vertical equity.
questionList.choiceC: parallel equity.
questionList.choiceD: generalized equity.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is true about professional ethics?
questionList.choiceA: Principles that guide persons in performing their job.
questionList.choiceB: Guiding standards motivated by political ideology.
questionList.choiceC: Behaving based on religious principles and doctrines.
questionList.choiceD: Guiding values of personal conduct in everyday life situation.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is an indication of poverty?
questionList.choiceA: Low mortality rate.
questionList.choiceB: High level of literacy.
questionList.choiceC: Income below one dollar per day.
questionList.choiceD: High average life expectancy.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the Regional States of the FDRE uses a camel as an emblem of its flag?
questionList.choiceA: The State of Afar.
questionList.choiceB: The State of Benishangul/Gumuz.
questionList.choiceC: The State of the Gambaela Peoples.
questionList.choiceD: The State of Somale.

questionList.questionStatement: One of the following is true about voluntary organizations. Which one is it?
questionList.choiceA: Controlled by government authorities.
questionList.choiceB: Focus on social, economic, or environmental issues.
questionList.choiceC: Mainly interested in political activities.
questionList.choiceD: Aim at maximizing the economic benefits of their founders.

questionList.questionStatement: Secondary sources of history include:
questionList.choiceA: ancient buildings.
questionList.choiceB: diaries and coins.
questionList.choiceC: inscriptions and monuments.
questionList.choiceD: history books.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is INCORRECT about tolerance?
questionList.choiceA: Accepting and valuing cultural diversity.
questionList.choiceB: Appreciating diversity of beliefs and views.
questionList.choiceC: Promoting extreme loyalty to one’s own culture.
questionList.choiceD: Rejecting stereotypes about cultural groups.

questionList.questionStatement: The traditional meaning of patriotism is:
questionList.choiceA: fighting for the territorial integrity of one’s country.
questionList.choiceB: serving communities to promote the common good.
questionList.choiceC: respecting the law and upholding constitutional values.
questionList.choiceD: promoting the development of democracy and peaceful co—existence.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following was a civil rights activist struggled against racial discrimination in the United States of America?
questionList.choiceA: Martin Luther King Junior.
questionList.choiceB: Nelson Mandela.
questionList.choiceC: Mohandas Gandhi.
questionList.choiceD: Thomas Jefferson.

questionList.questionStatement: Tolerance of diversity contradicts:
questionList.choiceA: respecting different viewpoints.
questionList.choiceB: appreciating religious pluralism.
questionList.choiceC: respecting the rights of cultural groups.
questionList.choiceD: promoting a single political identity.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is INCORRECT about cultural relativism?
questionList.choiceA: It encourages people to appreciate cultural diversity.
questionList.choiceB: It encourages ethnocentric feelings and practices.
questionList.choiceC: It minimizes conflicts among different cultural groups.
questionList.choiceD: It helps us to understand cultural values in their context.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is INCORRECT about Ethiopia?
questionList.choiceA: It became a member of the League of Nations in 1923.
questionList.choiceB: It became a member of the United Nations in 1945.
questionList.choiceC: It sent a peacekeeping force to North Korea in 1945.
questionList.choiceD: It contributed a lot to the foundation of the OAU in 1963.

questionList.questionStatement: Duties of a patriotic citizen include:
questionList.choiceA: refraining from criticizing government policies and strategies.
questionList.choiceB: being sceptical about the symbolic importance of the national flag.
questionList.choiceC: striving to promote individual interests at the expense of the public good.
questionList.choiceD: fighting against enemies to defend the national security.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is correct about national security and international community?
questionList.choiceA: Rich countries reduced development aid to poor countries to deal with security matters related to terrorism.
questionList.choiceB: Terrorist activities attacking the USA do not pose a threat to African countries.
questionList.choiceC: National security can be achieved in the absence of international security.
questionList.choiceD: Absence of security in Ethiopia would not affect the Horn of Africa and the Middle East.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is correct about global relations and concerns?
questionList.choiceA: Issues like poverty are concerns of a few countries of the world.
questionList.choiceB: The world is increasingly becoming bigger enabling countries to ignore globalization.
questionList.choiceC: Competition between countries has to be supported by cooperation to ease tension.
questionList.choiceD: Possession of nuclear weapons by several countries is a guarantee for global peace.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is INCORRECT about discipline?
questionList.choiceA: Proper dressing style,
questionList.choiceB: Practising religion in the work place.
questionList.choiceC: Respecting working hours.
questionList.choiceD: Building good working relationship.

questionList.questionStatement: Economic policy is:
questionList.choiceA: a perspective derived from academic research.
questionList.choiceB: an annual plan of action of a particular project.
questionList.choiceC: a specific guideline for a day-to-day economic activity
questionList.choiceD: a general direction for the economy of a country.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is INCORRECT about a genuine source of job satisfaction?
questionList.choiceA: Gaining social recognition as a result of a good work.
questionList.choiceB: Achieving success through collaboration with colleagues.
questionList.choiceC: Maximizing economic benefits using public resources.
questionList.choiceD: Achieving top performances and getting career development.

questionList.questionStatement: The Obligations of citizens include:
questionList.choiceA: building a democratic culture.
questionList.choiceB: paying tax regardless of age.
questionList.choiceC: creating a conflict free society.
questionList.choiceD: developing a homogeneous world view.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is true about morality?
questionList.choiceA: It is also called ethos and moral philosophy.
questionList.choiceB: It is a system of principles that guides human conduct.
questionList.choiceC: It is the philosophical study of human behaviour.
questionList.choiceD: It studies how moral standards affect human behaviour.

questionList.questionStatement: The protection and preservation of the environment includes:
questionList.choiceA: clearing the existing forest areas to expand mechanized farming.
questionList.choiceB: replacing small—holders' farming by mechanized and large—scale farming.
questionList.choiceC: enhancing environment—friendly development plans and activities.
questionList.choiceD: expanding agricultural practices that use a large amount of chemical fertilizers.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is ethically correct in providing services in the medical profession?
questionList.choiceA: Giving priority to people from the upper economic class.
questionList.choiceB: Giving priority to ones relatives, friends. and colleagues.
questionList.choiceC: Disclosing medical statuses and private matters of patients.
questionList.choiceD: Giving priority to patients who are in a critical situation.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following assertion is correct about dependency?
questionList.choiceA: Wise economic policies and effective utilization of resources are essential to overcome dependency.
questionList.choiceB: Dependency at the individual level cannot affect the economy of a nation.
questionList.choiceC: Dependent persons have ample opportunities to socialize and gain prestige in society.
questionList.choiceD: The current world order does not allow poor countries to minimize their level of dependency.

questionList.questionStatement: Micro economics deals with:
questionList.choiceA: average pre—capita income.
questionList.choiceB: the behaviour of consumers.
questionList.choiceC: gross domestic product of a nation.
questionList.choiceD: rate of inflation in a given country

questionList.questionStatement: The habit of saving can be improved by:
questionList.choiceA: worrying much about the present time than the future.
questionList.choiceB: increasing the amount of saving by cutting expenses for basic needs.
questionList.choiceC: limiting desires and purchases to the level of one’s income.
questionList.choiceD: borrowing money to satisfy the desire of spontaneous purchases.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is less important to promote a sustainable development in developing countries?
questionList.choiceA: Relying on Western innovation and technology.
questionList.choiceB: Promoting the culture of hardworking.
questionList.choiceC: Investing on human resource development.
questionList.choiceD: Developing effective policies and strategies.

questionList.questionStatement: Self-awareness can be improved by:
questionList.choiceA: developing an attitude of superiority.
questionList.choiceB: evaluating our strengths and weaknesses.
questionList.choiceC: imitating the behaviour of other people.
questionList.choiceD: focusing on our strengths and good qualities.

questionList.questionStatement: The behaviour of a passive person can be observed in his/her:
questionList.choiceA: listening to others without challenging their biased arguments.
questionList.choiceB: playing an active role in public debates and contributing ideas.
questionList.choiceC: sharing opinion without disregarding the views of other people.
questionList.choiceD: challenging practices that Violate the right and dignity of people.

questionList.questionStatement: The character of an assertive person is manifested in:
questionList.choiceA: little or no expression during discussions.
questionList.choiceB: an unfair demands and biased point of views.
questionList.choiceC: a good eye Contact during conversation.
questionList.choiceD: moving away from group discussions and deliberation.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is INCORRECT about the behaviour of aggressive persons?
questionList.choiceA: Speaking too loudly and staring at others.
questionList.choiceB: Standing rigidly and invading personal boundaries.
questionList.choiceC: Forwarding threatening expressions and looking down others.
questionList.choiceD: Having an open and polite expression

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is a negative impact of globalization?
questionList.choiceA: Availability of cheaper goods and products.
questionList.choiceB: Weakening the sovereignty of developing countries.
questionList.choiceC: Easy transfer of knowledge and technology.
questionList.choiceD: Better access to communication technologies.

questionList.questionStatement: The following require moral sensitivity in the medical profession EXCEPT,
questionList.choiceA: choosing an area of specialization.
questionList.choiceB: making decision related to abortion.
questionList.choiceC: facilitating medically assisted death.
questionList.choiceD: communicating HIV status of a client.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is true about self-reliance?
questionList.choiceA: Self—reliant persons reject any kind of support from other people.
questionList.choiceB: Self—reliant persons have limited interactions within the society.
questionList.choiceC: Building self—confidence is essential to lead a self- reliant life.
questionList.choiceD: Self—reliant persons do not consider the comments of other persons.

questionList.questionStatement: The most difficult activity in the process of decision making is:
questionList.choiceA: looking into alternative options.
questionList.choiceB: showing certain level of flexibility.
questionList.choiceC: gathering information about the issue.
questionList.choiceD: avoiding risks and uncertainties.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is INCORRECT about International Monetary Fund (IMF)?
questionList.choiceA: It is established by rich countries of the Western world.
questionList.choiceB: It supports developing countries to promote command economy.
questionList.choiceC: It requests developing countries to privatize state enterprises.
questionList.choiceD: It influences developing countries to liberalize their economy.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is the least important to address dependency at a country level?
questionList.choiceA: Relying on domestic resources and institutions.
questionList.choiceB: Developing indigenous knowledge and wisdom.
questionList.choiceC: Detaching the country from international trade.
questionList.choiceD: Encouraging local innovations and technologies.

questionList.questionStatement: The advantage of using quality goods produced locally:
questionList.choiceA: encourages the development of domestic factories.
questionList.choiceB: promotes imbalance between import-export trades.
questionList.choiceC: alienates domestic producers from an international trade.
questionList.choiceD: allows domestic factories to produce poor quality goods.

questionList.questionStatement: Saving habit can be improved by:
questionList.choiceA: increasing savings during old ages.
questionList.choiceB: increasing saving as income decreases.
questionList.choiceC: avoiding extravagant behaviour.
questionList.choiceD: decreasing saving when income increases

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is true about saving and saving institutions in Ethiopia?
questionList.choiceA: Modern banks are the best options of saving for the majority of the people in most parts of Ethiopia.
questionList.choiceB: The majority of the people in Ethiopia use iddir as a means of getting credit to start small businesses,
questionList.choiceC: Traditional institutions of saving do not help people accumulate initial capital to start a new business.
questionList.choiceD: Equb is considered as a means of forced saving because persons involved in it cannot quit easily.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is true about saving?
questionList.choiceA: Saving does not require short—term and long—term planning.
questionList.choiceB: Careful evaluation of one’s income and expenses is essential to make decisions regarding saving.
questionList.choiceC: We need to avoid spending on vacation and holidays in order to save.
questionList.choiceD: Thinking about saving is not essential for people who do not aspire to be rich.

questionList.questionStatement: The saving of a nation can be enhanced by:
questionList.choiceA: increasing the country's Gross Domestic Product.
questionList.choiceB: increasing the level of domestic consumption.
questionList.choiceC: encouraging the consumption of imported goods.
questionList.choiceD: discouraging the use of locally available products.

questionList.questionStatement: The power and functions of the FDRE President include:
questionList.choiceA: supervising the implementation of the country’s domestic and foreign policies.
questionList.choiceB: leading and coordinating the activities of the Council of Ministers.
questionList.choiceC: ensuring the implementation of policies adopted by the House of Representatives.
questionList.choiceD: granting pardon based on the conditions and procedures established by law.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is an ethical conduct essential to build the image of a business company?
questionList.choiceA: Using seductive dressing style in the working place.
questionList.choiceB: Serving every customer politely and effectively.
questionList.choiceC: Giving the best services to rich and powerful customers.
questionList.choiceD: Attending social and cultural events during working hours.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is true about the command economy?
questionList.choiceA: Government plays an important role in controlling market transactions.
questionList.choiceB: Market forces play the major role in determining market prices.
questionList.choiceC: Producers and consumers have freedom of economic decision making.
questionList.choiceD: Economic principles uphold free trade and the removal of trade barriers.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is INCORRECT about the benefits of active community participation?
questionList.choiceA: Empowering communities to solve their problems.
questionList.choiceB: Creating a bridge between government and people.
questionList.choiceC: Promoting the interest of opposition political parties.
questionList.choiceD: Engaging citizens to promote a holistic development.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is correct about myths?
questionList.choiceA: They are facts transmitted from generation to generation.
questionList.choiceB: They may serve the purpose of enhancing social unity.
questionList.choiceC: They do not have social, cultural and historical significance.
questionList.choiceD: They should be dismissed as they have no practical importance.

questionList.questionStatement: An assumption that serves as the basis of research is known as a,
questionList.choiceA: paradigm.
questionList.choiceB: perspective.
questionList.choiceC: hypothesis.
questionList.choiceD: philosophy.

questionList.questionStatement: The focus of academic reading is:
questionList.choiceA: getting pleasure.
questionList.choiceB: developing a hobby.
questionList.choiceC: enjoying creative works.
questionList.choiceD: acquiring knowledge.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following matches the pragmatic theory of truth?
questionList.choiceA: Truth is measured based on its usefulness for a person or a group of people.
questionList.choiceB: What is true at one time may not remain the same at other times.
questionList.choiceC: What is true in a given society may not be true in other societies.
questionList.choiceD: Truth depends upon objective facts that remain the same in space and time.

questionList.questionStatement: Which of the following is correct about the relativity of truth?
questionList.choiceA: Truth depends on objective facts.
questionList.choiceB: Truth is a universally accepted truth.
questionList.choiceC: Truth depends in time and space.
questionList.choiceD: Truth is measured based on it utility.
